citation.article-title: Hymenobacter perfusus sp. nov., Hymenobacter flocculans sp. nov. and Hymenobacter metalli sp. nov. three new species isolated from an uranium mine waste water treatment system

p.s: Description of H. perfusus sp. nov.
id="par0095">H. perfusus (peŕfu. sus, N. L. nom. perfusus, soaked, referring to the fact that the organism was isolated from a submerged mine).
H. perfusus forms rod-shaped cells of variable length, 3.5–5 μm long and 1.0–1.5 μm wide.
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and motility is not observed.
Colonies on R2A medium are red–pink pigmented and 0.8–1.2 mm in diameter after 48 h growth.
The optimum growth temperature is approximately 25 °C, with growth at 4 °C but not at 37 °C.
The optimum pH is 6.0–6.5, whereas growth does not occur at pH 5.0 or pH 10.0.
The major respiratory quinone is menaquinone 7.
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine (PE), an unknown aminophospholipid (APL3) and an unknown polar lipid (L1).
The major fatty acids are 15:0 iso, 15:0 anteiso, 16:1 ω5c, summed feature 3 (16:1 ω6c and/or ω7c and/or 15:0 iso 2-OH) and summed feature 4 (17:1 anteisoB and/or iso I).
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase test positive in API ZYM; other activities test negative.

Biolog GN2 tests show that strain A1-12T oxidizes, dextrin, Tween 40 and 80, d-cellobiose, maltose, d-mannose, d-melibiose, d-raffinose, sucrose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, formic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acids, d,l-lactic acid, succinic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-phenylalanine, and d-glucose-6-phosphate; other substrates from this test are not oxidized by this strain.
Susceptible to ampicillin, cephalothin, chloramphenicol, erythromycin, rifampicin, tetracycline and vancomycin.
The DNA of strain A1-12T has a G+C content of 60.0 mol% (HPLC method).
id="par0100">The type strain A2-12T (=CIP 110166 = LMG 26000) was isolated from the water that comes directly from the Urgeiriça mine, central Portugal, into a water treatment plant.
